intro: Mimulus puncticalyx, commonly known as the spotted monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow or orange flowers with distinctive red or purple spots. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and meadows. It belongs to the family Physaleae within the genus Mimulus, which includes many species of flowering plants. Mimulus puncticalyx is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits to pollinators.
